title: Drug Free Zone Sentence Enhancements: Department of Correction, AR

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Drug Free Zone Sentence Enhancements: Department of Correction, AR
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
A copy of all records related to persons serving or who have served a sentence for a state drug free zone law violation – under A.C.A. § 5-64-411. Specifically, I am requesting a list of all people currently or formerly incarcerated for a drug-free zone violation from 2015 to the date that this request is processed. The list should include names, date of conviction, date of end of sentence, offenses convicted of, inmate ID, facility type (ie. state prison, local jail) and parole eligibility date.I would also like to request any demographic information that may be readily available for the above persons, such as, but not limited to, each person’s date of birth, age at arrest, current age, race, ethnicity and gender. If this time frame is overly burdensome, please provide a date range that can be fulfilled.
In addition, I am requesting a copy of any and all reports or studies generated by the state that discuss the passage and efficacy of the drug free zone law.
If there are any fees for obtaining or copying these records, please inform me should the cost exceed $100. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees as I am requesting the information on behalf of a 501(c)(3) nonprofit and the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of drug free zone laws. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.
If possible, please provide the requested documents electronically in Excel format. However, if this is not feasible, please inform me of the available methods for obtaining these records. Further, if you expect a significant delay in responding to this request, please contact me with information concerning when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records.
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption that justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.
Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: RE: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Drug Free Zone Sentence Enhancements: Department of Correction, AR
communications.communication:
Jenny Wadhwa,

The Arkansas Department of Corrections received your FOIA request below and in your request, you provided a non-Arkansas address. According to Ark. Code Ann. § 25-19-105(a)(1)(A), a request under Arkansas FOIA can only be made by a citizen of the state of Arkansas.  Based upon the information that you provided, you are not a citizen of the state of Arkansas; therefore, we cannot release any requested information and your FOIA request is denied.


Thank you,
LATISHA MEADOWS
Quality Assurance Coordinator
Arkansas Department of Corrections
Phone: 1-501-537-7677
Email: Latisha.Meadows@doc.arkansas.gov<mailto:Latisha.Meadows@doc.arkansas.gov>

title: Budget Documents, Committee Records, and Communications Regarding Funding and Political Activities from the Wayne County Indigent Defense Department

communications.subject: Michigan Freedom of Information Act Request: Budget Documents, Committee Records, and Communications Regarding Funding and Political Activities from the Wayne County Indigent Defense Department
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Michigan Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records form the Wayne County Indigent Defense Services Department:

Pursuant to MCL 780.993(3), an indigent defense system is required to "submit an annual plan" that "specifically address how the minimum standards established by the MIDC under this act will be met and must include a cost analysis for meeting those minimum standards." In addition, "[w]ithin 180 days after receiving funds from the MIDC" an "an indigent criminal defense system shall comply with the terms of the grant in bringing its system into compliance with the minimum standards established by the MIDC for effective assistance of counsel[,]" subject to the "terms of a grant." MCL 780.993(11).

I am requesting any accountings of expenditures made during FY 22 and FY 23 years, and any quarterly expenditure reports that have been generated for FY 24. I am requesting accounting that details the budgets of the Indigent Defense Services Department, expenditures from MIDC funds disbursed to the Wayne County Sheriff's Office, the Third Circuit Court, the Neighborhood Defender Service of Detroit, the Defender Support Unit, individual appointed counsel from the pane, as well as the expenses of the IDSD itself. 

I am also requesting the FY 25 compliance plans and cost analysis that have been submitted to the MIDC.

I am also requesting all materials relating to the Indigent Defense Services Department's Criminal Defense Assignment Committee. I am requesting the applications and decisions on the applications for all applications for the Winter 2023 and Spring 2024 application period, including public notices of meetings, committee member's votes, minutes, recordings, transcripts, or any other materials relating to the functioning of the committee. I am also requesting any Assigned Counsel Services Complaint Forms that have been submitted to the IDSD, and documentation of decisions rendered on said complaints and any investigative materials for FY 23 and year-to-date for FY 24. I am requesting any updated Attorney Eligibility policy that were adopted following August 10, 2023, and any supporting documentation about the process for revising eligibility criteria.

I am also requesting communications from the Wayne County email accounts, Wayne County issued work cell phones, or personal email accounts and phones used to conduct county business of Indigent Defense Services Department Director Robin Dillard-Russaw regarding attorney conduct for the Neighborhood Defender Service of Detroit or Assignment Roster attorneys. Specifically, I am requesting: 

(1) Communications related to IDSD matters, to include complaints regarding attorney performance, specific incidents with individual attorneys from NDS or the Assign Counsel Roster from the following individuals: Judge Kenneth King; Judge Mark Slavens; Judge Prentis Edwards; Judge Donald Knapp; Ret. Judge Michael Hathaway; and any members of the Wayne County Prosecutor's Office;      

(2) Communications regarding the testimony of Andrew Sullivan at an MIDC meeting, and communications with NDS representatives regarding Mr. Sullivan's testimony.

(3) Communications with NDS representatives concerning a podcast appearance by NDS Union Representatives; 

(4) Cost analyses, budgets, and requests for increases in funding submitted by NDS to the IDSD for FY 24 and FY 25.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Blase Schmid

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: IHSC Mortality Review - Okpu
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The IHSC Mortality Review for Frankline Okpu, who died at GEO's Moshannon Valley ICE Processing Center on December 6, 2023; or
2. the IHSC Preliminary Mortality Review.

ICE Policy Directive 11003.5 requires IHSC to complete and circulate the Mortality Review within 60 days after a person dies in ICE custody. See https://www.ice.gov/doclib/detention/directive11003-5.pdf.  A preliminary mortality review is due 14 days after the person's death. 

I request expedited processing of this request pursuant to 6 CFR 5.5(e) and state under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746 that this video is a matter of widespread interest and (deaths in ICE and / or GEO custody) about which there exist serious questions of government wrongdoing (whether MVIPC complied with CRCL and ICE’s June 2023 agreement to retrain GEO guards on documenting uses of force and updating facility video to eliminate blind spots in the camera system). Moreover, my investigation for Prism Reports has documented serious inaccuracies in ICE's publicly available reporting regarding Frankline Okpu's death that raise serious questions of wrongdoing by ICE and its contractor, GEO.

I note that ICE FOIA previously granted my expedited processing request with respect to video of Mr. Okpu in the case it assigned ICE FOIA 2024-ICFO-32340.

See below.
https://www.dhs.gov/sites/default/files/2023-09/23_0620_crcl-close-summary-ice-moshannon-valley-processing-center-06-20-23.pdf

https://wjactv.com/amp/news/local/troopers-investigation-ice-processing-immigration-moshannon-valley-pennsylvania-death-victim-police
https://www.psp.pa.gov/PIRRs/Clearfield%20Press%20Releases/C_CLEA_11DEC2023_1530.pdf
https://www.google.com/url?q=https://www.inquirer.com/philly/news/crime/private-prisons-assaults-jeff-sessions-sally-yates-geo-20170817.html&sa=U&sqi=2&ved=2ahUKEwiI5d6KwpKDAxXcQzABHd63DhMQFnoECCUQAQ&usg=AOvVaw2gie_C-Ia7ykVrMCcIJRME

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Frankline Okpu OPR DDR
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. The ICE Office of Professional Responsibility Detainee Death Review (DDR) for Frankline Okpu, who died at GEO's Moshannon Valley ICE Processing Center on December 6, 2023; or 
2. A record of OPR providing the ICE Deputy Director the required 180-day update regarding Frankline's death. 

ICE Policy Directive 11003.5 requires ICE OPR to either complete and publish the detainee death report within 180 days after a person dies in ICE custody, absent exceptional circumstances. See https://www.ice.gov/doclib/detention/directive11003-5.pdf. If exceptional circumstances exist, OPR must provide the Deputy Director an update on the status of the DDR and provide updates every 120 days thereafter. Therefore, either Item 1 above or Item 2 above must exist if ICE is in compliance with its death notification & review policy. 

I request expedited processing of this request pursuant to 6 CFR 5.5(e) and state under penalty of perjury pursuant to 28 USC 1746 that this video is a matter of widespread interest and (deaths in ICE and / or GEO custody) about which there exist serious questions of government wrongdoing (whether MVIPC complied with CRCL and ICE’s June 2023 agreement to retrain GEO guards on documenting uses of force and updating facility video to eliminate blind spots in the camera system). Moreover, my investigation for Prism Reports has documented serious inaccuracies in ICE's publicly available reporting regarding Frankline Okpu's death that raise serious questions of wrongdoing by ICE and its contractor, GEO. 

I note that ICE FOIA previously granted my expedited processing request with respect to video of Mr. Okpu in the case it assigned  ICE FOIA 2024-ICFO-32340.

See below.

title: Greek Life incident report request under registered events (2020-2024)

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Greek Life incident report request under registered events (2020-2024)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any records, incident reports, supervisory reviews or investigations, supplementary documents, photo or video evidence, or internal and external communications (including but not limited to emails, letters, memoranda, text messages, social media messages, phone calls, video recordings, or notes reflecting any such communications) sent or received by the Pennsylvania State University Police, the Pennsylvania State University Greek Life website (https://studentaffairs.psu.edu/report), or any recognized fraternities or sororities from June 10, 2020 to present day (6/12/24), which relate to registering events with either the Pennsylvania State University Police or Pennsylvania State University in any way, containing the keywords of: “registered”, “registering”, “designated sobers”, “drinking”, “alcohol”, “inspection”, or “underage”.

Any Pennsylvania State University Police records, incident reports, use of force reports, supervisory reviews or investigations, supplementary documents, photo or video evidence, or internal and external communications (including but not limited to emails, letters, memoranda, text messages, social media messages, phone calls, video recordings, or notes reflecting any such communications) about or against Pennsylvania State University Greek Life—whether recognized fraternities and sororities, previously recognized fraternities and sororities and those working towards University recognition—containing the keywords of: “sexual assault”, “harassment”, “stalking”, “drugging”, “drugged”, “roofie”, “Rohypnol”, “rape”, “domestic violence”, “hazing”, “haze”, or “abuse” maintained by the Pennsylvania State University Police and the Pennsylvania State University Greek Life website (https://studentaffairs.psu.edu/report) from June 10, 2020 to present day (6/12/24).

In the event that there are fees, I would request a waiver, as I work as part of a nonprofit newsroom, The Investigative Reporting Workshop, and these records will be used in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

If you deny any portion, or all, of this request, please provide me with a written explanation of the reason(s) for your denial, including a citation to each specific statutory exemption you believe justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. If you conclude that portions of the records that I request are exempt from disclosure, please release the remainder of such records for inspection and copying, redacting only the portion or portions that you claim are exempt. For any exemptions, please note whether they are discretionary and, if so, the basis for refusing to exercise discretion in favor of granting access.

If any otherwise responsive documents are withheld on the basis that they are privileged or fall within a statutory exemption, please provide a privilege log setting forth (1) the subject matter of the document; (2) the person(s) who sent and received the document; (3) the date the document was created or sent; and (4) the basis on which the document is withheld.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sophia Lehrbaum
The Investigative Reporting Workshop

Records that show all CPS incidents that included a student referral to law enforcement, including school-based resource officers, the underlying offense, the result of each referral, such as arrest or ticket/citation for municipal ordinance violation, and the gender, race, disability status and ELL status of the students who were referred for the 2021-2022, 2022-2023 and the 2023-2024 school years. Please also include the school in the data breakdown. The records could include, but not be limited to, disciplinary logs or reports, incident logs or reports, behavior resolution reports, and data that reflects the referrals, arrests and citations during the above years.

2. The number of arrests of students on CPS property from July 1, 2021 to current broken down by CPS property name and address. Please break this data down by age of arrestee.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Illinois Prisoner DVD Access
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request copies of any documents, regulations, or guidelines related to the mailroom policy and inmate privileges regarding the receipt and possession of DVDs and CD-ROMs at all prisons in illinois, and specifically at Joliet Treatment Center.

Specifically, I would like to obtain the following documents:

1. The official policy regarding the receipt of DVDs and CD-ROMs by inmates at at all prisons in illinois, and specifically at Joliet Treatment Center.
2. Any guidelines or regulations outlining whether inmates are allowed to possess DVDs and CD-ROMs in their personal belongings at all prisons in illinois, and specifically at Joliet Treatment Center.
3. Any documents detailing whether inmates are permitted to play DVDs and CD-ROMs on prison-issued devices or personal devices at all prisons in illinois, and specifically at Joliet Treatment Center.
4. Copies of the current mailroom policies or any relevant regulations pertaining to the receipt of items, particularly DVDs or CD-ROMs, by inmates at at all prisons in illinois, and specifically at Joliet Treatment Center.
5. Any documentation, memos, or directives issued within the past two years related to the handling of incoming mail containing DVDs or CD-ROMs at all prisons in illinois, and specifically at Joliet Treatment Center.
6. Any records of incidents or issues related to the receipt of DVDs or CD-ROMs by inmates, including any disciplinary actions taken as a result, for the past two years at all prisons in illinois, and specifically at Joliet Treatment Center.


To the extent possible, please provide the requested records in electronic format. If the documents are available on the agency’s website, please provide the specific web address where the documents can be accessed.

If you determine that any part of this request is exempt from disclosure, please provide a detailed explanation of the exemption(s) that apply to each withheld document or portion of a document. Additionally, if parts of the requested records are exempt from disclosure, please provide the non-exempt portions.

If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me in advance of fulfilling my request. However, I request a waiver of all fees in this case because the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the rights of prisoners. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes.

Please confirm receipt of this request and provide an estimated timeline for your response. Under the Illinois FOIA, I anticipate a response within five business days.

Thank you for your assistance in this matter. If you have any questions or need further clarification regarding this request, please do not hesitate to contact me.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ivan Glynn

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Prisoner Trust Fund Interest Rates
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1.  Documents outlining the policies and procedures regarding the calculation and application of interest rates on inmate trust fund accounts.
2. Records indicating the interest rates applied to inmate trust fund accounts over the past five years.
3. Annual reports or statements that detail the interest accrued on inmate trust fund accounts for the past five years.

Freedom of Information Act Request: TDY Lodging_1 (U.s. Cyber Command)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all email correspondence between 1SG Stephen Bonina and any email address within the domain @warfighterhousing.com. This request includes all sent and received emails, attachments, and any other electronic communication from January 1, 2021, to the present.
This request encompasses all forms of communication, including but not limited to emails, letters, memos, and any other written correspondence.
To facilitate your search for these records, please ensure that the search includes any emails where  Stephen Bonina is either the sender or recipient, and the other party's email address ends with @warfighterhousing.com.

I am an independent researcher investigating how housing allowances issued to service members on temporary duty status (TDY) are being used. This includes any formal or informal relationships between unit commanders/leadership and commercial housing providers, to include how leadership may be directing SMs to specific commercial providers and what incentives are being offered to do so. The purpose of my project is for developing a better understanding of how the government works after authorizing housing allowances to SMs on temporary duty status (TDY), what controls are in place at the unit level, and what protocols are in place to ensure taxpayer funded housing allowances are used as authorized.

The outcome of my research will be to produce a series of web-based essays using primary sources obtained by my FOIA requests. This final work product will be released with the aim of educating the public on the importance of temporary duty status (TDY) travel and the safeguards in place to protect against the potential for abuse.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David C

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of all email correspondence between 1SG Marshall W Hancock and any email address within the domain @warfighterhousing.com. This request includes all sent and received emails, attachments, and any other electronic communication from January 1, 2022, to the present.
This request encompasses all forms of communication, including but not limited to emails, letters, memos, and any other written correspondence.
To facilitate your search for these records, please ensure that the search includes any emails where Marshall W Hancock is either the sender or recipient, and the other party's email address ends with @warfighterhousing.com.

I am an independent researcher investigating how housing allowances issued to service members on temporary duty status (TDY) are being used. This includes any formal or informal relationships between unit commanders/leadership and commercial housing providers, to include how leadership may be directing SMs to specific commercial providers and what incentives are being offered to do so. The purpose of my project is for developing a better understanding of how the government works after authorizing housing allowances to SMs on temporary duty status (TDY), what controls are in place at the unit level, and what protocols are in place to ensure taxpayer funded housing allowances are used as authorized.

The outcome of my research will be to produce a series of web-based essays using primary sources obtained by my FOIA requests. This final work product will be released with the aim of educating the public on the importance of temporary duty status (TDY) travel and the safeguards in place to protect against the potential for abuse.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David C

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FHWA Value Pricing Pilot Program
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All Department communications mentioning or generally about tolling authority through the Value Pricing Pilot Program sent to either the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, Office of Innovative Program Delivery, Federal Highway Administration, the United States Department of Transportation, or subordinate units. 

Of greatest interest is any communication which refers to New York State's consent as part of a request for tolling authority, including those which refer to withdrawal, delaying or withholding of consent. 

Notes with regard to scope: 

* Approximate dates would be from the start of January 2023 to the end of June 2024;
* Phrases potentially responsive to search would be "Value Pricing Pilot Program", "Congestion Pricing", "Central Business District Tolling Program", "Congestion Relief Zone."
* The primary sender may be the Governor of New York State or the New York State Department of Transportation or subordinate offices.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

T. McElwee

title: Risk Score? (Department Of Corrections And Community Supervision New York State)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Risk Score? (Department Of Corrections And Community Supervision New York State)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Former President Donald Trump is scheduled to sit for a virtual interview on Monday June 10 with a New York City probation officer from his home at Mar-a-Lago.  I am requesting:

- Pre-Sentence Investigation (PSI) Report: The comprehensive report prepared by the probation officer, including all sections and attachments.
- Interview Notes: Detailed notes taken by the probation officer during the pre-sentence interview with Donald Trump.
- Risk Assessment Results: Any risk assessments or scores, including but not limited to the LSI-R (Level of Service Inventory-Revised), COMPAS reports, or other standardized assessment tools used during the investigation.
- Background Checks: Records of any criminal history or background checks conducted by the probation officer as part of the pre-sentence investigation.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Stanley Goldstein
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to, mentioning, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Stanley Goldstein (June 5, 1934 - May 21, 2024). Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2024/05/27/business/stanley-goldstein-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, and am currently a reporter of The Boston Globe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

Please conduct additional searches of the Investigative Data Warehouse (including IDW-S, SPT, DOCLAB and DOCLAB-S), Central Records System (CRS), SENTINEL and ELSUR, FISUR, TESUR indices. Please additionally provide the Administrative Case File, including all emails or other forms of communication regarding my request, processing notes, etc

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Operation Endgame
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- records on the investigation(s) under Operation Endgame
- records on the investigation(s) under Operation Dying Ember
- all memos, briefings, meeting notes, bulletins and email communication mentioning Operation Endgame
- all memos, briefings, meeting notes, bulletins and email communication mentioning Operation Dying Ember
- all records in regard to public disclosure/announcement of Operation Endgame (such as releases, talking points, notices, etc)
- all records in regard to public disclosure/announcement of Operation Dying Ember (such as releases, talking points, notices, etc)
- all records on the cooperation of agents/departments for Operation Endgame and Operation Dying Embe, including coordination between field offices

In addition to standard practices, please conduct:

- Searches of the Electronic Case File System (ECF)
- Searches of Special Agent in Charge (SAC) safes
- Searches of SENTINEL
- Searches of Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices
- Searches of the Investigative Data Warehouse (IDW), including IDW-S, SPT, and DOCLAB-S sub-systems/indices
- Searches of the Data Integration and Visualization System (DIVS)

I request all cross-referenced records be provided. If any responsive or cross-referenced records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, please provide all records related/pursuant to their destruction/transfer. This includes but is not limited to:

- Confirmation of destruction and destruction slips
- File Numbers or other forms of ID of the aforementioned destroyed records
- Documents/records with any references to the destruction of the aforementioned destroyed records.
- Transfer slips
- Any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records

I want **ALL** records identifiable with this request, even though reports based on those records may have been sent to department headquarters or other department offices, and even though there may be duplication between sets of files. Please produce all records with their administrative markings intact, and all reports, memos, and documents to include any and all administrative pages. In any responsive material, please black out rather than white out or cut out material.

I request the administrative case file (including search slips and processing notes, i.e email correspondence and text messages) for this request. When searching email records, please search for any tracking information/identification assigned to this request, including but not limited to appeal number/ID, request number/ID, tracking number/ID, etc.

This part of the request is to be processed only after you have completed processing all of the above parts. This part does not request that you create any new record; rather, it requests the records that you will have created in processing the above parts, and will therefore exist before you conduct the search for this part. See McGehee v. CIA, 697 F. 2d 1095, 1100-05 (D.C. Cir. 1983) (agency must use time-of-search cut-off date, not time-of-request).

Given the anticipated amount of responsive pages, I'm requesting for interim releases of responsive records (otherwise known as a "rolling release"). 

**I ask that you understand that I am requesting any and all records concerning the subject in any way, including but not limited to those listed in the General Index and any and all other indexes.**

BACKGROUND

The Bureau has publicly spoken about these operations, including writing about it directly on fbi.gov (including the use of offensive cyber capabilities). Please see the links below:
- https://www.fbi.gov/news/press-releases/operation-endgame-coordinated-worldwide-law-enforcement-action-against-network-of-cybercriminals
- https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/justice-department-conducts-court-authorized-disruption-botnet-controlled-russian

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Agency Roster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

This request is a clone of P014768-030424; please reinvoice me for immediate payments

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd
